prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape being constructed: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Creating the 2D Sketch (face_1) 1. Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw line_1: Start Point at (0.0, 0.0), End Point at (0.75, 0.0). 3. Draw line_2: Start Point at (0.75, 0.0), End Point at (0.75, 0.5625). 4. Draw arc_1: Start Point at (0.75, 0.5625), Mid Point at (0.6951, 0.6951), End Point at (0.5625, 0.75). 5. Draw line_3: Start Point at (0.5625, 0.75), End Point at (0.0, 0.75). 6. Draw line_4: Start Point at (0.0, 0.75), End Point at (0.0, 0.0). Creating and closing Loop_1 1. Select line_1 and line_2. 2. Create a loop with line_1 and line_2 by connecting their endpoints. 3. Select arc_1. 4. Connect the start point of arc_1 to the end point of line_2. 5. Connect the end point of arc_1 to the start point of line_3. 6. Complete Loop_1 by connecting the end point of line_3 to the start point of line_1. Creating Loop_2 1. Create a new loop with circle_1. 2. Set the center of circle_1 to (0.375, 0.375) and the radius to 0.1875. Loop_2 is automatically closed once the circle is drawn and its endpoints are connected to the sketch plane. Creating the 3D Solid Scaling the 2D Sketch Set the sketch scale to 0.75. Extruding the Sketch 1. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.375. 2. Perform a New Body Feature Operation with the current part. 3. The resulting solid will have a length of approximately 0.75, width of 0.75, and a height of approximately 0.375. 4. This new solid represents the first part in the CAD assembly.</description>
